result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry Michael Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Rock County Ordinance - Disorderly Conduct-DV. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry Michael Phillips

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice re: Court appointed attorney
Court appointed attorney's fees paid by accounting.  Defendant is ordered to reimburse Rock County for payment of attorney fees.

records.addlTxt: Order for Payment for Attorney Fees

9:03 AM Defendant Terry Michael Phillips not in court.  Attorney Richard Russell McCue Jr in court for Terry Michael Phillips.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Count 1 orally amended to Forfeiture. State to file Forfeiture Complaint. Defendant pleads no contest to count 1. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1. Court orders a fine of $500 and costs due within 60 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Letter to Courts from attorney McCue

9:52 AM Defendant Terry Michael Phillips in court by video.  David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds the Defendant indigent and appoints attorney Richard McCue. Defendant to reimburse the County $100 per month.  Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 08:45 am.

10:42 AM Defendant Terry Michael Phillips in court in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Alexander David Goulart appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to notify the courts of new address. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $450.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victims R.M., L.S., N.P. or T.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
